result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip R Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

No in person contact with victim Samantha B. and her minor child unless approved by court or agent.
Telephone and electronic contact with victim granted. After 10 BIP classes, with consent of the victim, no contact order will be changed to no violent contact.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Phillip R Olson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.
Received and Filed, Proof of verification on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Phillip R Olson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Micha Schwab appearing under the Student Practice Rules as supervised by Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.   Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties, defendant, and Samantha B. 

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 80 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 2 days time served, with Huber privileges. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 40 days in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No in person contact with victim Samantha B. and her minor child unless approved by court or agent. Telephone and electronic contact with victim granted. After 10 BIP classes, with consent of the victim, no contact order will be changed to no violent contact.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.


Filed: 
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned for Probation Review Hearing in branch 36.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Phillip R Olson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Final Pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution.
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state, the court ordered Count 2 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed Telephone Contact.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: Missed Telephone Contact.

Defendant Phillip R Olson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. All motions to be filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Phillip R Olson in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak via telephone.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Pre-trial Conference. Case heard off the record. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Defense requests an adjournment due to inability to appear in court. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SAMANTHA B. AND HER CHILD(REN).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Phillip R Olson in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Phillip R Olson in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Phillip R Olson
Current: 1000 S 108TH ST LOT A2A, Greenfield, WI 53214   (Effective: 02-07-2015)
Prior: 10175 West Coldspring Road, Greenfield, WI 53228
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
